Comment: Nayak & Singh (1983) claim the ventral cibarial sense organ is composed of two sensilla: the ventral and the dorsal sensilla. In contrast
and Stocker & Schorderet (1981) report three sensilla: the proximal
the middle and the distal sensilla. This is shown via enhancer trap activity in Gendre et al.
the number of chemosensory neurons varies: both Nayak & Singh (1983)
Ventral cibarial sense organ neuron of m.Definition: Neuron that innervates the middle sensillum of the ventral cibarial sense organ. There are two of these per sensillum.
